intro: Knautia sylvatica var. pocutica, commonly known as the alpine knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its foliage consists of ovate to lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. This variant is distinguished by its compact growth habit and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
